poem:
Title: "Echoes of the Global Hearth"

Houses stray, 
the value as fleeting as confetti in May,
Yet hunger's figures dance a bitter reel, 
in the world's marketplace, the unfed feel.

Bear of the East, gorged on greed, 
hoards interest, planting inflation's seed. 
Economies wane, while summits pretend,
The ink is dry but the story doesn't end.
